page.title: 12The Goathland Hunt Kennels.
page.content:
Although it was not always situated at its present site in the block,this pack{dates back to the 16th century } and is one of the oldest in the country.At present there are{25 couple {of foxhounds.
Foxes are a problem to farmers and poultry keepers and there is{very good {support}for the hunt.At an average meet there might be 40 on horse and about 25 cars. Regular followers include farmers, farm workers, solicitors, game-keepers, estate agents, binmen, coal miners and other local people.
The Goathland Hunt{area is diverse}and includes moorland, agricultural land and some woodland. This will probably always be a pro fox-hunting area.
